fields.lead: The temporary General Prosecutor, Eduard Harunjen, asked today the Superior Council of Magistrates (CSM) for approval to commencement of criminal investigation and criminal liability of a magistrate from Rezina law court. CSM members voted "for".
fields.Continut:
His file was started under the Article 307 of the Criminal Code - pronouncement of a judgment, decision, conclusions or making decisions contrary to the law - and is investigated by the Prosecutor’s Office for the Combating of Organized Crime and Special Causes

The General Prosecutor's Office (PG) sources tell us that it would be about Andrei Balan. He was confirmed again as a judge in the Rezina law court, by the Presidential Decree no. 996-VII on 17 February 2014.

items.title: The CSM approved to criminally investigate a judge from Rezina

fields.lead:
UPDATE (12:40) // The Press Officer of the General Prosecutor’s Offic, Maria Vieru, confirmed for Deschide.MD that Andrei Pantea was arrested for the excess of duties – the transfer of the Karamalak case in the Russian Federation, when he was the Temporary General Prosecutor.

The quoted source also told us that Pantea was arrested at home, without resistance. The Anti-corruption prosecutors conducted searches at his residence and will not communicate if something was found. In these moments, Pantea is in the CNA's insulator.
fields.Continut:
The former Prime Deputy Prosecutor - Andrei Pantea, who executed as well the function of the temporary General Prosecutor of the Republic of Moldova, was arrested by the Anti-corruption prosecutors, are communicating the sources of Deschide.MD.

At the end of June, in a Deschide.MD investigation, we announced about the fact that Andrei Pantea would have helped the investigation committee of the Russian Federation to close the file of the thief in law, Gregory Karamalak, alias "Bulgaru". The Criminal prosecution was discontinued in December 2015 - a year and a half away from the transfer of his case to the Moscow, proceedings conducted under the signature of Andrei Pantea.

“There were interests. Mr. Pantea being the Prime Deputy Prosecutor, knew very good about the SCJ decision, which was annulling the judge completion of the Rascani, Genadie Morozan, and respectively, had no right to transfer the file to the Russian Federation. From what I know, he did abuse of service and signed the transfer decision when the General Prosecutor Zubco was not in the country. There were rumors that for this transfer were proposed large amounts of money: between 500 000 and 1.5 million dollars, and if there are rumors of this kind, the truth usually is about in the middle” declared to us then the former prosecutor of Chisinau, Ivan Diacov in a comment made to Deschide.MD.

In turn, Pantea refused to comment on rumors about the amounts which, some say, he would be charged, instead he wanted to explain his decision to transfer the case to the Russian authorities from the legal point of view:

"I will not comment the statements of Mr. Diacov beause I do not want to give any weight to this man, with all due respect that I have towards his career .... All legal procedures were followed, and over the transfer worked an institutional group, therefore, until it came under my signature, the procedure has been prepared by many others. More than that, I returned the file several times because they were not complied with all the requirements for transfer ", told us in detail Andrei Pantea.

Asked it is true that the transfer was done when Procuorul General was not in the country, Pantea told us: "It does not matter whether it was or was not. He not initiated this process because the responsibilities were divided."

A strange fact is that at the end of the discussion, the former Prime Deputy Prosecutor rhetorically asked us on an almost annoyed note: “But who is afraid of this Caramalac. Why do you make him a national hero by paying him so much attention? I think that this is a thing of the past.”

Details and documents at this topic you can find in the following article: EXCLUSIV / Ruşii i-au clasat dosarul lui Caramalac. Pântea i-a ajutat?

We mention that Andrei Pantea resigned from his position after the Supreme Council of Prosecutors accepted at September 21, 2015 the request for dismissal. The former prosecutor did not indicate in the application the reason for his leaving.

Gregory Caramalac was charged on the fact that since the mid 90's of last century, the group under his leadership committed a series of murders and robberies, kidnapping, extortion and banditry. In 2008 he obtained Russian citizenship, although in 1998 he was Internationally wanted.

Currently, Caramalac appears in friendly pictures with the leader of "Our party", Renato Usatai, and according to unconfirmed reports he would be one who would finance multiple pro-Russian actions in our country.

items.title: UPDATE / The ex-Temporary General Prosecutor - A.Pantea, ARRESTED for „closing” the Karamalak case

fields.social_Titlu: ODIP calls on voters to support unionists, regardless of leaning
fields.lead: The public association “Honor, Dignity and Homeland” (ODIP) announced that it remains apolitical and supports none of the candidates for President in the current campaign. Members of the association said they support the approaches and actions of the unionists, aimed at propagating the ideal of the union of the two states, and thus call on the electors to vote for the unionists, no matter who these are.
fields.Continut:
ODIP head Vlad Biletski told a news conference at IPN that it would be incorrect for society to favor one of the candidates. The voters are those who should judge and analyze the promises and deeds of the electoral competitors.

"I call on the people to take part in the elections as the right to vote is a basic right, being in some of the states an obligation for showing one’s will, because others will decide instead of us if we do not decide," stated the young man. 

Vlad Biletski noted that ODIP is conducting in Chisinau an opinion poll that covers a sample of 5,000-6,000 people. The goal is to identify the percentage of those who are for the union. It will be thus possible to know the real situation as regards the union, not the informant provided by fixed polls.

The young members of ODIP also aim to stage activities to commemorate the late singers Doina and Ion Aldea Teodorovici.

"For 24 years we have been poorer because we lost two martyrs of the Romanian nation. The association ODIP takes this moment into account and, because presidential elections will be held on October 30, we will hold the commemoration event on October 28, simultaneously in 13 education institutions," stated ODIP secretary general Lucia Vieru.

The songs of the late singers will be played on this day during breaks in a number of lyceums and universities. Moments of silence will be observed also. The students will be informed about the life and work of Doina and Ion Aldea-Teodorovici.

"We consider it is extremely necessary to form and educate the patriotic spirit among students and teachers as well," added the young women.

Also, a 1 km long tricolor will be stretched on Stefan cel Mare Blvd, from the Parliament Building up to the Academy of Sciences of Moldova, on December 1. This year the tricolor will be the longest in the last few years. After the event, several tens of meters of the flag will be donated to universities, schools and kindergartens in Chisinau so that they raise the tricolor on the National Flag Day on April 27, 2017.

items.title: ODIP calls on voters to support unionists, regardless of leaning

fields.social_Titlu: SCPES warns: ORANGE CODE for heavy rain
fields.lead: According to the State Hydrometeorological Service data in Moldova are expected heavy rains and strong winds on October 12 and 13, 2016
fields.Continut:
In this context the Service of Civil Protection and Emergency Situations (SCPES) urges people to follow the recommendations of the authorities. At the same time, the administration of water basins from the territory is asked to ensure the good condition of protective dams and dikes and remove the barriers from small river beds, ensuring the normal outflow of the stream.

Drivers are asked to adjust the motor vehicle speed to road conditions and avoid traveling through flooded areas. In case of danger people can ask for help by calling 901.

items.title: SCPES warns: ORANGE CODE for heavy rain

fields.social_Titlu: Intellect Group poll: EU - 54 %, Customs Union - 45 %, Unification - 19 % and NATO - 12 %
fields.lead: The European option prevails in society towards accession to the Customs Union - Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan. According to the Intellect Group poll, if the citizens had to choose next Sunday between the European Union and Customs Union, 46 percent claim to be for EU and 36% - for Customs Union; 18 percent did not provide any answer.
fields.Continut:
As for citizen involvement in any campaigns that promote the pro-European option of Moldova: 49.5 % - said they will participate, 36.4 % - will NOT, and 14.2 did not provide an answer.

Another question in the poll was: Which of the following parties do you think best represents the European vector of Moldova?

According to the results, PDM gatheres 29,2 percent, PAS, 21,2 %, PPDA - 17,1 %, PPEM - 5,1 %, PL - 3,6 percent, PSRM - 2,0 %, PLDM - 1,0 %, PN - 0,9 %, PCRM - 0,4 %, other parties 0,3% and 19,2 % did not know what to answer.

In the case that next Sunday would take place a referendum, 54 percent of the respondents would vote for Moldova's accession to the European Union and 28% against. 

For the Customs Union - Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan - 45 percent would vote, and 31 % - against it

For the Unification of Moldova with Romania would vote 19% and 56% - against it

For the accesion to NATO of Moldova would vote 12%, and 61% - against it

Editor's note: the other numbers that were not displayed are part of those who will not go to the referendum, undecided ones and those who did not answer those questions

The poll was conducted from September 29 to October 9, 2016 on a representative sample of 1847 people and has a margin of error of +/- 2.3 percent.

items.title: Intellect Group poll: EU - 54 %, Customs Union - 45 %, Unification - 19 % and NATO - 12 %

fields.social_Titlu: INP is warning: Albisoara street from Chisinau is blocked because of the heavy rains
fields.lead: The National Patrol Inspectorate announces that on 124 Columna street, a tree has fallen and the road traffic is blocked for the moment. Also is blocked the road traffic on the Albisoara street.
fields.Continut:
At the moment, road traffic on the Albisoara street is stopped completely because the flow of water collected after heavy rains, also is traveling with difficulty on I.Creanga street.

The National Patrol Inspectorate has involved double patrol crews that are targeted to aid the drivers and pedestrians in distressed.

items.title: INP is warning: Albisoara street from Chisinau is blocked because of the heavy rains

fields.social_Titlu: Chisinau will negotiate better conditions for Moldovans in Russia
fields.lead: The Government authorized a delegation led by Deputy Minister of Labor Anastasia Ocheretnyi to negotiate and initiate an agreement of cooperation in the area of labor migration between the Governments of Moldova and Russia.
fields.Continut:
There are about 50,000 Moldovan migrants in Russian Federation, according to the statistics of the competent federal services. However, according to Moldovan officials, the real figure is much higher. The agreement that is to be signed will solve a part of the problems of migrants, including those related to the obtaining of work patents, and will create conditions for more migrants to work legally, reports IPN.

The agreement will be signed for a period of five years, with extension for consecutive three-year periods if the signatories do not have other proposals.

In the same meeting, the Cabinet approved the signing of an inter-ministerial cooperation agreement in the area of labor with Lithuania. This agreement will enable to learn from Lithuania’s experience in adjusting the national legislation to the EU’s and to mobilize technical assistance for implementing policies in the area of social protection and family. The accord will be signed for an indefinite period, while the cooperation program will be agreed by the sides at the beginning of each year

items.title: Chisinau will negotiate better conditions for Moldovans in Russia

fields.social_Titlu: The Transnistrian „army” is training for an attack at the border
fields.lead: Alleged armed forces in Transnistria are conducting military exercises for rejecting an attack on the Transnistrian border. Transnistrian armed forces were put on alert on Wednesday, October 12.
fields.Continut:
The soldiers were equipped and armed very quickly and transported their weapons and technics in an area previously indicated, where points to meet staff and technology were organized.

The new exercise will be conducted in three stages. One of the stages involves preparing the military units for battle. The chief of staff of Armed Forces, Serghei Gherasiutenko, executed control exercises.

At this stage of the exercises, Transnistrian soldiers used equipped weapons: AK-74 automatic rifles, grenades, and other weaponry. In particular, they have trained on the disassembly and assembly of the automatic rifles. In addition, Transnistrian soldiers followed a course of medical aid to the wounded ones: binding and transporting on a stretcher.

During the engineering exercises, military personnel done some landmine mockups and practiced vaulting the mined obstacles. The soldiers were also trained to climb up and down from an armored transport.

The exercises will continue for several days, during which the Transnistrian troops will perform a series of tasks for combat training.

items.title: The Transnistrian „army” is training for an attack at the border

fields.lead: The citizens of Moldova with the right to vote will be able to cast their ballots with the expired passport. A decision to this effect was taken by the Central Election Commission on October 14, IPN reports.
fields.Continut:
CEC member Iurie Ciocan said that according to the data of the state-run Information Resources Center “Registru”, there are almost 410,000 persons with passports whose period of validity expired. The condition is for the expired passport to contain the personal numerical code, which is not indicated in the passports issued before 2000.

A number of 100 polling places will be established outside Moldova’s borders for the October presidential elections. Of these, 25 polling places will be opened in Italy, 11 in Romania, 8 in Russia, while 7 in the U.S.

Source: IPN

items.title: Good news for Diaspora // Moldovans abroad will be able to vote with expired passport

fields.lead: May 8, June 2 and September 1 in 2017 could be declared nonworking days for which the budget-funded employees would work on other days. A bill to this effect was proposed for debates by the Ministry of Labor, Social Protection and Family.
fields.Continut:
Instead, May 13, June 10 and September 9 will be declared working days, IPN reports.

The salary-earners who will not be involved in labor relations, those whose individual work contracts will be suspended or will be on leave on the days declared nonworking will not obliged to present themselves at the workplace on the days of Saturday that will be declared working days..

items.title: Labor Ministry suggests changes to 2017 calendar of nonworking days

fields.lead: Media nongovernmental organizations of Moldova consider the October 12 Cabinet decision to dismiss Ion Terguta from the post of director of the Teleradio Company MIR in Moldova is a reaction to the criticism leveled by the journalist against the current government. In a statement, the NGOs express their concern about the decision to propose Valeriu Renita, former spokesman of ex-President Vladimir Voronin, to the MIR Board of Directors for being appointed to this post.
fields.Continut:
"From our point of view, this appointment forms part of the current government’s strategy aimed at subduing as many media outlets as possible and at transforming them into the ‘speaking trumpet’ of the power, contributing to greater media concentration. Persons in the antechamber of the president of MIR Company R.I. Batyrshin told us that the institution does not possess information about the dismissal of Ion Terguta," reads the statement.

The signatories call on the Cabinet to review its October 12 decision. According to them, MIR broadcasts round-the-clock on the territory of most of the countries in the CIS, covering millions of TV viewers. That’s why it is very important for the channel to correctly and equidistantly reflect the reality in Moldova.

The signatories warn the administration of MIR that the Cabinet’s decision to remove journalist Ion Terguta from the post of director of the Company in Moldova is an act of injustice based not on professionalism-related reasons, but on the rulers’ goal to subdue the press.

Among the signatories of the statement are the Independent Journalism Center, the Association of Independent Press, the Electronic Press Association, “Acces-Info” Center, the Journalistic Investigations Center, and the Association of Independent Telejournalists.

items.title: Media NGOs condemn appointment of new „MIR” director

fields.social_Titlu: Gorbuntsov's revelations about Usatii and Platon and the true masters who want to „buy a country”
fields.lead: UPDATE (21:19) Shortly after the publication of German Gorbuntsov's interview, the mayor of Balti, Renato Usatii, posted comments on his Facebook page: Again, before the election, Plahotniuc is using Gorbuntsov. We saw this in 2014 when, before withdrawing us from the election, he blamed me of all the bad things. This happens again, Plahotniuc's media-holding is preparing a new movie, where Cristi Tabara and Andrei Cojocaru will fool the whole country. We will see this "melodrama" together... Then I will be online and you will understand, however Plahotniuc will be charged according to the law. His fear that I will destroy their system, can be justified.
fields.Continut:
The leader of "Our Party", Renato Usatii and Veaceslav Platon, dubbed "No.1 Raider from CIS", are just some doers of their masters in Moscow that "want to buy a country to become honourable citizens". This is said by German Gorbuntsov, in an interview with the blogger Veaceslav Balacci. Coincidence or not, but this interview occurred after a group of prosecutors and Ministry of Internal Affairs (MAI) officers conducted a working visit to London, where Gorbuntsov is now.

In the interview of over 30 minutes, German Gorbuntsov, dubbed the "black banker" and former shareholder of Moldovan bank Universalbank, says that the "scheme of  Russian billions laundering is almost identical to that of Renato Usatîi becoming the majority shareholder in Universalbank" that belonged to Gorbuntsov. The interviewee makes similarities because both schemes were carried out bythe  banks of two members of the criminal group "Solntsevo" - Boris Usherovich and Valery Markelov, but also the President of JSC "Russian Railways" - Vladimir Yakunin, which would be a close friend of Putin's family. The first two are those who "actively participated" in the billions' scheme and even "invented it. The link between these two schemes is very simple, Renato is working for them [Boris Usherovich and Valery Markelov - Eds.]. He is just a doer. He is doing the work he is paid for, stealing, killing ... everything he can do."

Regarding the situation in Universalbank, Gorbuntsov said he met with the former Prime Minister, Vlad Filat, who had promised to help him, "however he did the opposite. Renato Usatii was always waving the ID papers stating that he is Vlad Filat's advisor. After the issue evolved to law court, Usatîi was helped by Platon, who is known in Russia." The banker also says in the interview that he has proposed to Usatîi to come to London and pass a lie detector test, and if what Gorbuntsov declares is not confirmed, then he will apologize publicly to Usatîi. However, the leader of "Our Party" did not accept the invitation.

Regarding the political career of Usatîi in Moldova, Gorbuntsov said that PN president "must be at the helm of country" in order to justify the money he received from "serious guys" [...] "They want to buy a small country to run and hide [Boris Usherovich and Valery Markelov - Eds.], [...] in order to become honourable citizens in a small country." Gorbuntsov added that the Moldovan Prosecutor General's Office (PG) is working with Scotland Yard - Metropolitan Police Service and Crown Prosecution Service of Great Britain in its case and that the law authorities of the two countries begin to identify common elements on these lines. However, Gorbuntsov declares that cooperates with law enforcement authorities of both countries.

In this context, Gorbuntsov says that Usatîi would have tried the other days to pay through an intermediary 600 thousand dollars to the family of Vitalie Proca, who had tried to assassinate Gobuntsov in London, so Proca could give false testimony where the mayor of Balti would not be included.

It should be noted that a group of Moldovan prosecutors from Prosecutor’s Office for the Combating of Organized Crime and Special Causes (Lilian Bacalîm - prosecutor in the organized crime department of PG, Valeriu Bodean - chief of the Organized Crime department and Petrușenco Ruslan - police colonel, chief department, Special causes DOS of IGP), altogether with the officers of the General Inspectorate of Police (IGP) (Gheorghe Cavcaliuc - deputy chief of IGP) of MAI paid a working visit to London. During this visit, Moldovan prosecutors had meetings with the representatives of the Scotland Yard - Metropolitan Police Service, Crown Prosecution Service, and of the National Crime Agency of Great Britain. The trip aimed at strengthening the bilateral relations between the law-enforcers from those two countries, and also touched on common cases of organized crime relating to both Moldova and Great Britain, in which citizens from both countries were involved.

The full interview you can view here.

items.title: Gorbuntsov's revelations about Usatii and Platon and the true masters who want to „buy a country”

fields.lead: The intermediary of Renato Usatîi was detained after he tried to get a false testimony from the killer Vitalie Proca in favour of the leader of "Our Party". More specifically, it is about Valeriu Malarciuc, who, in exchange of a huge amount of money, had to obtain from Proca a testimony through which the latter denies the fact that Usatai hired him to kill the businessman German Gorbuntsov and also accuses other persons.Meanwhile, the Moldovan prosecutors have not responded yet to our calls to officially confirm the detention of Valeriu Malarciuc.
fields.Continut:
The detention of Malarciuc (photo, on the left) was done this weekend by the Moldovan prosecutors altogether with the General Inspectorate of Police (IGP) collaborators. The man  The man had intermediated the obtaining of false testimonies from the criminal, Proca in order to save Renato Usatîi from the consequences of acusations against him in the file of assassination attempt of businessman German Gorbuntsov. The action took place in Romania, where Proca is detained, and the one, who did the operation, returned to Moldova to complete the action.

Our sources from the investigation say that Valeriu Malarciuc has admitted his guilt. Moreover, the investigators have interceptions of Proca's conversations, who is detained in a prison in Romania, on which he plotted the details and the amount of money he would receive for these testimonies. Prosecutors also have identified other persons that Renato Usatîi used to plan this setup.

We remind that about the "mission" of Malarciuc, also spoke Gorbuntsov in the recent interview for the blogger Veaceslav Balacci. In the interview, the businessman who is a refugee in London, sent a message to Renato Usatîi saying that this operation will not succeed, because he knows the name of the intermediary and the amount of money that would be paid. It seems that also Gorbuntsov is the one who alerted the authorities of several states interested in the case, about this operation.

We note that previous days on the Prosecutor General's Office site and the IPG one was published a press release about a visit of several investigators in London (Lilian Bacalîm - prosecutor in the organized crime department of PG, Valeriu Bodean - chief of the Organized Crime department and Petrușenco Ruslan - police colonel, chief department, Special causes DOS of IGP and Gheorghe Cavcaliuc - deputy chief of IGP).

Apparently, it seems to have been an official working visit, but our sources say that actually the Moldovan investigators attended the hearing of Gorbuntsov and exchanged information with British investigators on the case. Moreover, the information is confirmed by a photo published today by the blogger, Balacci.

The reason that Proca's false testimony staging was attempted seems to be based on the investigation's progression and respectively - the attempt of Renato Usatii to save himself. Moreover, for more than a month "Our Party" leader left the country and did not return yet.

We remind you that in spring of 2012, German Gorbuntsov was shot 7 times as he entered his flat in London. It was later determined that the culprit was Vitalie Proca - a killer, later convicted for another crime committed at command in Bucharest. Later, Gorbuntsov offered a first interview on this subject in which he said that his death was ordered by Renato Usatîi - who does what the other two businessmen from Russia tell him, former friends and business colleagues of Gorbuntsov. The last two, in turn, are under the protection of Russian Railways chief - a man close to Vladimir Putin.

After the revelations and accusations of Gorbunţov, Usatîi wrote a denunciation to the Moldovan Prosecutor General's Office by saying that in fact he had been the target of an assassination. Based on his denunciation was started a criminal dossier, and previous days, the deputy chief of the Prosecutor’s Office for the Combating of Organized Crime and Special Causes, Corneliu Bratunov, declared that "the only file in the investigation where appears Renato Usatîi is the one initiated by him, on other people initiated a long time ago where several stages of the investigation passed and the new elements are some details that incriminate inclusively the author of the testimony."

It should be also noted that, yesterday, Shortly after the publication of German Gorbuntsov's interview, the mayor of Balti, Renato Usatii, posted comments on his Facebook page: Again, before the election, Plahotniuc is using Gorbuntsov. We saw this in 2014 when, before withdrawing us from the election, he blamed me of all the bad things. This happens again, Plahotniuc's media-holding is preparing a new movie, where Cristi Tabara and Andrei Cojocaru will fool the whole country. We will see this "melodrama" together... Then I will be online and you will understand, however Plahotniuc will be charged according to the law. His fear that I will destroy their system, can be justified.

Meanwhile, the Moldovan prosecutors have not responded yet to our calls to officially confirm the detention of Valeriu Malarciuc.

We will come back with details...

items.title: EXCLUSIVE // Usatii's Intermediary is detained! He tried to „buy” testimonies from the killer Proca

fields.lead: The patent holders will take to the streets on October 20. The protest will be first mounted in front of the Government Building. Afterward, the protesters will go on a march to the Parliament Building, president of the Small Business Association Eugen Roscovanu stated in a news conference at IPN. He said the situation of patent holders becomes increasingly difficult owing to bureaucracy and they thus decided to protest.
fields.Continut:
"The economy is stagnant, while the national bureaucrats compete against each other in creating barriers to businesspeople and new constraints. They permanently invent strange bills and Government decisions in a move to make the existence of small businesses more difficult. Thus, the number of small enterprises decreases, revenues from sales decline and the number of new jobs created at small and medium-sized enterprises diminishes. The foreign and home trade indexes decrease, while the government produces triumphalist reports," stated Eugen Roscovanu.

He added that the economic crisis in the country deepens, while the regulations that should promote the development of small businesses do not stimulate this sector. This fact made the business people to take to the streets.

Director of the Small Business Association’s branch in northern Moldova Grigore Marciuc said the working group that was to be constituted by the government to discuss the problems of patent holders, with the involvement of representatives of small businesses, has done nothing yet. The small traders were invited to no meeting of this group. The patent holders from the northern districts are ready to protest as soon as possible because it is impossible to work in the conditions proposed by the authorities.

Local councilor in Stefan Voda, Olga Cheapki, patent holder, said the government, which she called deaf and mute, does nothing but pretend to be doing reforms. The patent holders agreed to have their way of activity modified from 2017, but asked for an alternative, but the alternative proposed by the government, which is shifting from patent to enterprise, does not ensure a job and social grantees.

"As you did nothing to create new jobs, you should not remove the patent. Do not touch it. We ask to be listened to and heard. I call on all the patent holders to combine forces and take to the streets to demand rights," she stated.

Eleonora Turcanu-Herghelegiu, director of the southern branch of the Small Business Association, said there are entrepreneurs who earn more than 300,000 lei a month, but these represent 5-10% in district centers, unlike Chisinau and Balti, where this figure is much higher. The woman called on the authorities to take into account these differences when formulating policies in the field.

Local adviser in Rezina Alexandru Veshnieski, patent holder, said that 20% of the SMEs went bankrupt during the past year and the state of affairs in the national economy is far from being good.

"We do not want to be the exchange card in someone’s games. We do not want to do politics. We ask one thing from the government – to find a method of solving the problem of those who work based on patent," he stated.

The patent holders concluded that if the situation does not improve, a large part of the national entrepreneurs will move to the underground economy or will emigrate.

Source: IPN

items.title: The patent holders intend to mount protest on October 20

fields.lead: The Broadcasting Coordination Council (BCC) has announced a contest to distribute the available radio frequencies 883 MHz, 100.2 MHz and 105.0 MHz.
fields.Continut:
According to BCC, for two of these frequencies expired the validity term of broadcasting licenses issued to broadcasters Plus FM Sângerei and Bas FM Basarabeasca. Frequencies are open to competition because Bas FM Basarabeasca has not asked for an extension of the broadcasting license and the other broadcaster submitted te request too late, IPN reports.

In addition, the Ministry of Information Technology and Communications asked BCC to announce the competition for the frequency 88.3 MHz which has coverage in Panasesti village, Straseni district.

items.title: BCC announces contest to distribute radio frequencies

fields.social_Titlu: Usatii accuses MAI and PG of plotting with Gorbuntsov
fields.lead: Renato Usatii accuses the investigative bodies of Moldova of plotting with German Gorbuntsov and of the fact that the prosecutors and MAI officers did not detain recently the banker when he was on the territory of Moldovan Embassy in London. The leader of "Our Party" is sure of the charges that he brings, although it is well known that Gorbuntsov turned himself in to British authorities in 2014, and therefore he is no longer internationally wanted.
fields.Continut:
The Mayor of Balti says that instead of exercising his duties towards the law and to arrest the offender on the territory of the embassy, according to certified international norms as a territory of Moldova, the representatives of MAI management and Prosecutor General Office of Moldova, have chosen the heap show way.

"Gorbuntsov is wanted by Interpol, he is in the red nook. This means that at any time, in any country of the world, he must be arrested. Not interrogate him, not get him under control, but to arrest him. As if to say, they went to take depositions from the one who is internationally wanted," Usatîi said, mentioning that on the name of banker Gorbuntsov are opened several criminal cases. 

We specify, however, that the former president of Universalbank, German Gorbuntsov, has turned himself in on March 21, 2014 at the Metropolitan Police Service Extradition Unit (Scotland Yard). Afterwards, he was arrested, based on three warrants. After his collaboration with Scotland Yard's investigation he was removed from the list of persons under international search, in which he was in 2012. About his collaboration with investigators tells Gorbuntsov himself in an interview with the blogger Veaceslav Balacci.

At the same time we remind you that Gorbuntsov omitted to say in the same interview, that he was suspected for several crimes between 2010 - 2011, i.e. blackmail, attempted of obstruction of justice, theft and attempted of murder. The banker says that when he left Moldova no criminal case was not opened on his name.

Until he fled in 2010 from Russia to Moldova, Gorbuntsov held at least eight banks in the Russian Federation, many of them being involved in money laundering and tax evasion.

items.title: Usatii accuses MAI and PG of plotting with Gorbuntsov

fields.lead: The prosecutors announced that they detained two people who tried to "buy" from killer Vitalie Proca, false testimonies in the case on assassination attempt of banker German Gorbuntsov. Prosecutors declined to give the name of the one who ordered the false testimonies, but in the public space is known that is Renato Usatîi. Investigators say the two people detained, cooperate with the investigation and have already admitted guilt.
fields.Continut:
One of those detained went to Bucharest, where is detained Vitalie Proca, met with killer and gave him a tape recorder for the latter to record his false testimony. Later the "messenger" returned to Moldova, from where he went to Moscow to meet with the final beneficiary (Renato Usatîi - Eds.).

The testimony was supposed to be purchased from Proca in exchange of a sum of 600 thousand dollars. A first tranche of 100 thousand was granted to one of the two detained who has bought more goods including a car, and the second part of the money was given to Proca's wife. The latter has also bought a luxury car.

Prosecutors say they have all the documents confirming this and more phone records that lead to the final beneficiary.

The police say that the final beneficiary (Renato Usatîi - Eds.) will certainly have a procedural status in this file. This, however, is going to be determined later by those managing the investigation.

We remind you that in spring of 2012, German Gorbuntsov was shot 7 times as he entered his flat in London. It was later determined that the culprit was Vitalie Proca - a killer, later convicted for another crime committed at command in Bucharest. Later, Gorbuntsov offered a first interview on this subject in which he said that his death was ordered by Renato Usatîi - who does what the other two businessmen from Russia tell him, former friends and business colleagues of Gorbuntsov. The last two, in turn, are under the protection of Russian Railways chief - a man close to Vladimir Putin.

After the revelations and accusations of Gorbunţov, Usatîi wrote a denunciation to the Moldovan Prosecutor General's Office by saying that in fact he had been the target of an assassination. Based on his denunciation was started a criminal dossier, and previous days, the deputy chief of the Prosecutor’s Office for the Combating of Organized Crime and Special Causes, Corneliu Bratunov, declared that "the only file in the investigation where appears Renato Usatîi is the one initiated by him, on other people initiated a long time ago where several stages of the investigation passed and the new elements are some details that incriminate inclusively the author of the testimony."

As well we remind that Deschide.MD wrote two days ago about the detention of one of the persons that the prosecutors referred to. It is about Valeriu Malarciuc, who, in exchange of a huge amount of money, had to obtain from Proca a testimony through which the latter denies the fact that Usatai hired him to kill the businessman German Gorbuntsov and also accuses other persons. About the "mission" of Malarciuc, also Gorbuntsov said in the interview given the previous days to the blogger Veaceslav Balacci.

items.title: NEWS ALERT // New details on the "bought" testimonies from the killer Proca, in the Gorbuntsov case

fields.lead: Minister of Education Corina Fusu made an order by which the orthographical norms of writing “â” (pronounced like in the word Grecheanîi) and “sunt” (I ‘am’ (sunt), not ‘sînt’ as earlier) became mandatory for the national education institutions.
fields.Continut:
According to a press release of the Ministry of Education, the order was signed with the aim of ensuring compliance with the decision of the Supreme Council for Science and Technological Development of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova, IPN reports.

The order provides that the textbooks, methodological guidebooks, teaching aids and other educational resources will be designed/printed by taking into account the orthographical norms of writing “â” and “sunt” in the Romanian language.

The order takes effect when it is signed.

items.title: Wring with “â” and “sunt” become mandatory in all education institutions

fields.lead: Three more people were detained in Gorbuntsov file. The information was confirmed for Deschide.MD by the case prosecutor, Vitalie Busuioc.
fields.Continut:
The state accuser told us that after searches conducted today were taken as evidence two cars, mobile phones, documents and other electronic devices - carrying information. Busuioc did not want to tell us where searches were unfolded and who the detainees are, but said that each of them had some degree of involvement in the case and will be investigated to establish everybody's participation.

From sources close to the investigation, we managed to find out that those arrested would be his wife, brother-in-law and a friend of the killer Vitalie Proca.

Previously, the prosecutors announced the detention of two people involved in the Gorbuntsov file. A 44 years old businessman and Valeriu Malarciuc, a 33 year old unemployed person with a criminal antecedents.

They admit their guilt and cooperate with the investigation.

One of them went to Romania, where he met with Vitalie Proca, convicted for an assassination attempt in another case.

items.title: News ALERT // The wife, brother-in-law and a friend of Proca, detained in Gorbuntsov file

fields.lead: The mayor of Orhei, Ilan Shor before attending the court hearing has sent greetings to someone: "Hello Chatterbox."
fields.Continut:
Asked by press who is "chatterbox" Ilan Shor said that "the whole country knows who he is" and his full message was the following one:  "Hello Chatterbox" (trans. from Russian - Balabol). From what I understand we will not meet soon. Even if I am under house arrest, but in the country. I can handle the problems of the city”, Shor said.

In this context we mention that often the appreciation "Chatterbox" was assigned by Internet users - to Renato Usatîi. The nickname was given also by the Socialist Igor Dodon in several TV shows.

Shor also confirmed that he is going to be heard as a witness in the dossier of former Prime Minister Vlad Filat.

items.title: Shor, who attended the court, has sent greetings to someone: Hello Chatterbox!

fields.social_Titlu: NEWS ALERT // The Prosecutors have arrested 3 more customs officers and 4 more border policemen
fields.lead: Three employees of Customs Service and four Border Police officers from Otaci Border Point and a driver were detained today after several searches conducted by the Anti-corruption Prosecutors together with employees from the National Anti-Corruption Center.
fields.Continut:
The representative of the Prosecutor General's Office, Maria Vieru, confirmed the information for Deschide.MD, noting that the Anti-corruption prosecutors, along with CNA employees, conducted searches this morning, at the Otaci Customs Office.

"The searches were carried out in the framework of a criminal case initiated on the fact of passive corruption, committed by several persons, with extortion. As a result of the criminal investigation, were detained 8 people: 3 customs officers, four employees of the Border Police and a driver," added Vieru.

According to the same source, a driver was gathering 200 lei from each passenger to speed up the passage of customs control and border police.

It is important to mention that the information about conducting these searches was confirmed by the head of Customs Press Service, Cristina Rau, who informed us that the details of this operation will be provided later today.

We will return with details.

We remind you that on September 30, twenty-eight employees of Customs Offices from Tudora and Palanca were detained by the Anti-corruption Prosecutors and CNA officers, being suspected of passive corruption. It is about customs officers, heads of laps, heads of post, and deputy head of the Bender Customs Office.

Then the detentions took place as a result of major searches at Tudora and Palanca border checkpoints, but also at the homes of suspects. The Prosecution Groups raided this morning, to gather evidence of illegal collection of funds by customs inspectors from people who were carrying agricultural food products to the Ukrainian market. In exchange for failing border controls and not revealing possible violations, the inspectors were charging illegal fees from travelers.

The shift manager and customs inspectors of Tudora border checkpoint, during the performance of duties, by corrupt behavior, under various pretexts claimed, extorted, accepted and received from different people crossing the customs the Tudora post, financial means, which they have accumulated, keeping them in the service office. After an unannounced audit conducted recently by inspectors of the Department of Homeland Security Customs Service, were detected in the cabinet of the service office of the the shift manager of the Tudora border checkpoint, money in different currency.

Operative inspections were made also at the Palanca border checkpoint, and the prosecutors have found similar criminal activity, which has a continuous nature. As a result of special measures of investigation, of the actions of a criminal investigation and hearing of witnesses, it was found that the money would not be stopped at inspectors, but would have been transmitted to the shift managers, who in turn were transmitting them to the Heads of Border checkpoints. Finally, the collected means wold be reached at the Chief of Customs Bureau of Bender.

items.title: NEWS ALERT // The Prosecutors have arrested 3 more customs officers and 4 more border policemen

fields.lead: The Former Temporary Prosecutor General, remains in custody. The Magistrates dismissed the appeal of Andrei Pantea lawyers  on his placement in custody. The decision was made today at the Court of Appeal.
fields.Continut:
Pantea is detained for "ultra vires" in the Karamalak folder. He received 25 days in the isolator on October 13. The decision was taken by Buiucani Court magistrates.

He was detained by anti-corruption prosecutors, who incriminated him that he passed  illegally to the the Prosecutor General's Office of the Russian Federation the criminal dossier on the name of Grigore Karamalak interlope. Subsequently, the Russian Prosecutor's Office dismissed the case on the grounds that the Moldovan side infringed several procedural rules related to passing a criminal case.

Andrei Pantea left the system in September 2015 after several scandals and accusations against him. He led for a few months, the Prosecutor General's Office after the resignation in January 2013 of Valeriu Zubco. Pantea was then first deputy prosecutor general, a post he held since March 2010. After the termination of the mandate at the beginning of 2015 Andrei Pantea was transferred to the position of Deputy Prosecutor of Chisinau municipality, Ion Diacov. Pantea however resigned in September 2015, days after former municipal prosecutor, Ion Diacov has accused him during a press conference that he violated the law.

items.title: Andrei Pântea, remains in custody. The Appeal Court rejected the appeal of lawyers

fields.lead: Children will no longer be involved in promoting non-recommended food. An order to this sense was signed by the Minister of Health, Ruxandra Glavan. From this list are products with high content of sugars, fat, salt, food additives, which have a higher nutritional value of 300 kilo-calories per 100 grams.
fields.Continut:
Thus, children will not be involved in advertising caramels, chocolate, chips, burgers, sandwiches, pizza, sausages, salted peanuts, soft drinks and energy drinks. It is also forbidden to promote the involvement of minors at spices such as vinegar, mustard, pepper, horseradish, ketchup, pepper and other similar products.

By order of the Ministry of Health, the chief doctors of Public Health Centers will be responsible for supervising the institutions of general education of children rational nutrition and lack of information and promotional advertising for foods that endanger the health of preschool students and students.

According to the Administrative Code, those who do not observe these provisions will be sanctioned with a fine ranging from 10 to 150 conventional units for individuals and from 100 to 500 conventional units for legal entities.

Source: ipn.md

items.title: Children will not be able to appear in advertisements for non-recommended products

fields.lead: Anti-corruption prosecutors and CNA officers raided the Licencing Chamber and the homes of the staff members this morning.
fields.Continut:
According to our sources, the searches are taking place at this time, and prosecutors seek evidence of entering false information into the database of the e-licensing system aiming the prolongation of licenses for operators engaged in gambling activities.

Our sources say that several detentions could take place in this case.

Stay tuned for details.

items.title: NEWS ALERT // Searches at the Licensing Chamber. False data in the e-licensing system

fields.lead: Vlad Plahotniuc announces a new goal. After he promoted the necessary regulation of casinos' activity and a few days ago police shut them all down, the politician is after drug dealers. In a message posted on his blog, Plahotniuc warns those dealing with such activities that the countdown has begun.
fields.Continut:
Vlad Plahotniuc believes that in the case of casinos, the authorities acted correctly and firmly.

"The things were solved by closing the gambling saloons, and their work is to be resumed only after their activity is strictly regulated and there will be ways adjusted to control both the location sites as well as the payment of state taxes or to fully abide the prohibition on children’s access to such places. To understand what a criminal group was acting behind this activity is sufficient to notice how they attempted to fraud the licensing system after the intervention of the authorities in this area was publicly announced. They hoped to gain fraudulently one more year in this way and oppose the measures taken by institutions", Plahotniuc wrote.

According to him, "that persons not only have to pay the damages to the state, but must answer before the law and for the way they tried to prolong criminal activity. As well, the officials who helped him must go behind bars."

Further, Vlad Plahotniuc says that another serious problem is related to the drug consumption. This topic is on the agenda and with his colleagues in the ruling coalition and institutions, they will do everything possible to stop this phenomenon, and those who have participated in developing them will answer before the law.

 "Unfortunately, this phenomenon is more noticeable also among children. The adult giving narcotics to children actually destroy lives, therefore they are criminals and must be treated duly. My message to all those involved in this criminal activity is clear: the countdown has begun, it's just a matter of time before they are caught. Short time. This topic is on my agenda and together with colleagues from the ruling coalition and institutions, we will do everything possible to stop this phenomenon, and those who have participated in developing it will answer before the law.

My message to all those involved in this criminal activity is clear: the countdown has begun, it's just a matter of time before they are caught. Short time.", Plahotniuc concluded.

We remind that about 1,000 police officers have received this weekend the mission to shut down and seal all casinos in the country after on Saturday the Licensing Chamber announced that it has suspended 65 licenses of activity for gambling, stakes, casinos and game machines. Police officers were about to close 320 casinos that currently have a valid license of activity.

The suspension of 65 licenses is due to multiple violations identified in the review carried out by the Financial Inspection under the Ministry of Finance and investigations conducted by the Anti-corruption Prosecutor's Office together with the National Anti-Corruption Center.

Among the infringements found was the defrauding of the "e-licensing" system which led to a large-scale damage of state budget.

We remind that five employees of the State Licensing Chamber were arrested on Saturday after an operation conducted by anti-corruption prosecutors and CNA officers.

The public servants, including the Deputy Director of the institution, are suspected of having committed a series of frauds on the issue or extension of licenses for operators, providing services in the field of gambling, which caused damage of 15 million lei to the state budget.

items.title: Vlad Plahotniuc has a new goal: To combat drug dealers

fields.lead: The Central Law Court issued the warrant of arrest for 30 days on the name of the President of "Our Party", Renato Usatii, previously put under accusation for ordering the murder of Russian banker, Gherman Gorbuntov.
fields.Continut:
The court ordered the application of the preventive measure in the form of preliminary arrest for 30 days with the calculation since the moment of arrest.

We remind you that on Saturday, October 22, Central Law Court examined the prosecutor's request on issuing an arrest warrant on the name of Renato Usatii and putting into international search for expropriation of the Russian banker, Gherman Gorbuntov, of the majority of shares he held at "Universalbank" from Chisinau, but also because he ordered his assassination.

According to the prosecutor's order, Usatîi is accused of extortion in especially large amounts, namely that through an offshore company, he has disowned Gorbuntov of 68 000 401 shares amounting to over 113.5 million lei. At the same time, the politician is accused of having ordered and organized the attempt to assassinate Gorbuntov, refugee to London.

The meeting was postponed on Monday because the politician's lawyers requested to recuse the judges.

items.title: The Central Law Court issued a warrant of arrest for 30 days on the name of Usatii

fields.lead:
The Deputy Director of the Licensing Chamber will spend the next 30 days in the Penitentiary No.13. Buiucani Law Court's decision.
Also, a warrant for a period of 30 days was issued on behalf of a chief of direction within the same institution. She will stay in custody in the CNA isolator.
fields.Continut: The decisions were taken in the casinos' file, and on three other people detained, the prosecutors will decide today.

items.title: Casinos dossier // Two chiefs from the Licensing Chamber in custody for 30 days

fields.lead: The masked one ensuring the security of Veaceslav Platon, are jamming the statements that he makes in the halls of Buiucani District Court. When he is moved from one office to another and wants to say something, one of the masked persons start the two-way radio causing a noise more powerful than the voice of Platon.
fields.Continut:
So, when the accused starts talking, journalists cannot hear his statements.

We publish below a video sequence from realitatea.md.

items.title: VIDEO // Platon is jammed in the Court so the journalists could not hear his statements

fields.lead: (UPDATE 15:45) Head of Anti-Corruption Prosecutor's Office, Viorel Morari declared for Deschide.MD that by this time 28 police officers were detained, but the operation is ongoing.
fields.Continut:
(UPDATE 15:15) Temporary Prosecutor General, Eduard Harunjen told Deschide.MD that details on this operation will be provided in a press briefing at 17:00. According to him, by now 24 policemen were detained, but the operation is ongoing.

Dozens of employees of the National Inspectorate Patrol were detained a few minutes ago by the anticorruption prosecutors. It all happened during a working meeting with the entire staff, an event held at the Ministry of Internal Affairs (MAI).

A few minutes ago there was a large operation of Anti-corruption Prosecutor's Office and the Inspection Directorate Effective of the IGP, during which were detained dozens of policemen from the National Inspectorate Patrol (Traffic Police). Our sources could not specify the exact number of detainees because everything happened in an unexpected way, during a meeting of the organization held at the MAI, where the country membership was present.

According to the sources, the policemen concerned were read from a list, and as soon as they stood up they were detained by the anti-corruption prosecutors in front of their colleagues. The operation is based on several flagrant actions, which were held in the last few days in which undercover agents have filmed the police officers while taking bribes in order not to impose fines for various infringements of road legislation, including consumption of alcoholic drinks while driving.

At the meeting where took place the detentions, was also held the awarding of other policemen, who did not fall for the temptation and have done their duty properly.

items.title: Breaking NEWS // Dozens of policemen detained during a working meeting at MAI

fields.social_Titlu: Igor Cernat, the head of Ialoveni Fiscal Inspectorate is placed in custody for 20 days
fields.lead: The Head of the Fiscal Inspectorate from Ialoveni, Igor Cernat, was arrested for 20 days after the court decided today to apply the preventive measures - the detention. Cernat will spend almost three weeks in the Penitentiary No. 13 in the capital.
fields.Continut:
The information was confirmed for Deschide.MD by the Acting Deputy Chief of the Prosecutor's Office for the Combating of Organized Crime and Special Causes, Corneliu Bratunov.

Igor Cernat was arrested on Monday by the prosecutors for a case of money laundering and tax evasion. At the same time he will be submitted charges for excess of power.

According to Ialoveni.info, Igor Cernat is the head of the Ialoveni Fiscal Inspectorate since 2013. Since then he purchased several luxury cars, built a splendid house and opened multiple business, where investments have been made worth millions of euros.

items.title: Igor Cernat, the head of Ialoveni Fiscal Inspectorate is placed in custody for 20 days

fields.social_Titlu: The detained policemen case // 10 chiefs of the INP are suspended from their position
fields.lead: 10 chiefs of the National Inspectorate Patrol (INP) were suspended from their position, being suspected of involvement in illegal actions of detained police officers last days during a Police General Inspectorate (IGP) meeting, informs the press service of IGP.
fields.Continut:
The Inspection Directorate Effective of the General Police Inspectorate have initiated investigations on the case of detained policemen for committing passive corruption acts, it is shown in a press release of the institution.

We remind you that on October 25th 2016, the Anti-corruption Prosecutor Office was informing about the detention of the policemen under the National Inspectorate Patrol for committing passive corruption.

The operation of arresting took place at the National Inspectorate Patrol of IGP of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the illegal acts of policemen being documented with the support of the General Police Inspectorate.

items.title: The detained policemen case // 10 chiefs of the INP are suspended from their position

fields.lead: Multiple doctors, police officers and waiters from several clubs of the capital were detained for drug trafficking in a joint operation of the General Prosecutor Office with Police General Inspectorate (IGP)
fields.Continut:
Prosecutors and IGP officers conducted throughout yesterday, last night a major action on the detection and apprehension of drug traffickers, and also of several officials who were covering their illegal activity. According to our sources they were already made several arrests, and among those are handcuffed doctors, police officers and waiters from several clubs in the capital.

The searches are continuing. Until now there are 10 people detained.

We will come back with an update...

items.title: Doctors, police officers and waiters - arrested for drug trafficking. The searches continue

fields.lead: Orhei city mayor, Ilan Shor, remains in house arrest. The Appeal Court dismissed the request of lawyers on changing the preventive measure.
fields.Continut:
Therefore, Appeal Court kept the decision from October 20 on Shor's placing in house arrest for 30 days.

At the exit from the courtroom, Shor said that the court decision demonstrates that he is a person uncomfortable for the government.

At the same time, the lawyet of Orhei mayor, Iulian Balan, declared after the decision that more questions arise about the attitude of judges on this case and there are real reasons on addressing to the European Court for Human Rights.

items.title: Appeal Court decided: Ilan Shor stays in house arrest

fields.lead: The favoring and disfavoring of candidates in the presidential elections became more accentuated at some of the broadcasters, shows the last monitoring report produced by the Broadcasting Coordination Council. This covered the period between October 10 and 19. Thus, seven TV channels were fined the highest amount 5,400 lei, a TV channel was warned publicly, while three broadcasters were only warned, IPN reports.
fields.Continut:
The report shows the TV channels with national coverage - Prime TV, Canal 3, Canal 2 and Publika TV - continued to massively favor the Democratic Party’s candidate Marian Lupu and to disfavor the candidate of the PPPDA Andrei Nastase. Jurnal TV favored massively the PPPDA’s candidate and disfavored the PDM’s candidate. It should be noted that the monitoring covered the period before Nastase and Lupu withdrew from the presidential race.

During October 10-19, Accent TV and NTV Moldova presented the Socialist candidate Igor Dodon mainly in a favorable light compared with the other election runners.

All these broadcasters were fined the highest amount.

N4 was warned publicly for covering insufficiently the election campaign. Realitatea TV, Pro TV and Ren Moldova were warned over the slight imbalance in covering the election campaign. The public TV channel Moldova 1 covered the electoral activities of the candidates for President rather impartially.

"The situation is worse compared with the first report both in terms of the imbalance in the volume of airtime and of the connotation of the materials. Even the broadcasters that we gave as an example as regards the covering of the election campaign now didn’t ensure a proper balance," said the Councils chairman Dinu Ciocan.

Council member Olga Gututui said the broadcasters were obliged to offer airtime to all the candidates, but only Moldova 1 did this.

"I will request the broadcasters to provide information about whom and when they allotted airtime," she stated.

Member Mariana Onceanu-Hadarca said the report shows the citizens of Moldova are used as voting machines. She stated that Prime TV, Canal 3, Canal 2 and Publika TV continue to defy all the broadcasting norms, noting a democratic society is not possible with antidemocratic covering.

The Council members expressed their regret at the fact that the broadcasting legislation wasn’t amended so that the punishment matched now the gravity of the committed violations.

items.title: 7 TV channels fined for improperly covering electoral campaign

fields.lead: (UPDATE 3:39 p.m.) 30 people were detained until this time within today's operation at Leuseni and Sculeni customs posts. It is about 14 customs officers, three border guards, 6 economical operators and 7 drivers. Details about this operation will be provided in a briefing to be held today at 05.00 p.m. at the CNA headquarters.
fields.Continut:
(UPDATE 01:19 p.m.) By now have been detained 24 people including 13 customs officers, 3 border police officers, 4 drivers and 4 businessmen, says National Anti-corruption Center (CNA) press officer, Angela Starinschi. Meanwhile, sources within the investigation say that they will be placed in the isolator of the Municipality Police since CNA isolator is full. We remind that Sculeni and Leuşeni customs were reopened after being closed for three hours by the anti-corruption prosecutors and CNA officers.

(UPDATE 11:12 a.m.) Until now have been detained 14 people including 10 customs officers and 4 businessmen, says National Anti-corruption Center (CNA) press officer, Angela Starinschi. 

(UPDATE 09:11 a.m.) Leușeni and Sculeni border-crossing points were reopened. Officers and anti-corruption prosecutors have completed searches at the two customs, but the operation continues with searches at the homes of many customs officers. 

(UPDATE 09:07 a.m.)By this time, seven people  have been detained, including five customs officers and two economic agents.

(UPDATE 08:55 a.m.) By this time, six people  have been detained, including five customs officers and one economic agent.

(UPDATE 08:51 a.m.) Deputy Head of the Customs Service, Grigore Ionițov told Deschide.MD that the operation is organized jointly with the internal security department of the customs service. He also said that the two checkpoints remain closed, but big queues have not formed, yet. The detained customs officers are suspected of passive corruption.

There are more searches conducted at two customs and the homes of customs officers. According to our sources it is a corruption case, and today's action will end with several restraints.

Deschide.MD reminds that a month ago, other 28 customs officers were detained at Palanca and Tudora border-crossing points in a similar operation.

We will come back with details.

items.title: (UPDATE) Searches at Sculeni and Leușeni Customs. Outline: 30 restraints

fields.lead: A new form of illegality on the gambling market was blown and decomposed by the Intelligence and Security Service jointly with the Prosecution Office for Organized Crime Combat and Special Causes.
fields.Continut:
The raids took place at the end of last week in one of the premises located across Chisinau municipality, where a specialized group in the organization and maintenance of poker was operating without following the payment of taxes to the state budget in large proportions.

At the time of the operation, the intelligence officers and local prosecutors have found in about 60 customers, including civil servants. Similarly, they raised 11 poker tables, playing cards and chips, an impressive amount of money came from proceeds, a computer, equipment and servers used in criminal activity, including objects and substances prohibited by law.

During the special investigative measures it has been established that the group operated under the guise of a non-profit public organization for a long time, and its members were working as entrepreneurs clandestinely without holding licenses, permits, thus managing to accumulate considerable income.

The SIS officers and prosecutors continue the actions in criminal proceedings.

items.title: VIDEO // SIS „stormed” a clandestine casino. Among the guests were also civil servants

fields.social_Titlu: The Customs Service took actions in CNA and PA raids case from Leuseni and Sculeni
fields.lead: The Customs Service took action after CNA officers and anti-corruption prosecutors have conducted searches at Leuseni and Sculeni border crossing points and ordered the initiation of two internal investigations to establish all the circumstances of the invoked illegalities.
fields.Continut:
Also, at the request of the investigative bodies has been given assistance to the Internal Security Department, a subdivision of the Customs Service, responsible for examining cases of misbehavior and corrupt behavior among employees.

The institution mentioned in a press release that, under the started reforms, the institution adopted a zero tolerance policy towards any involvement of employees in corruption acts or crime schemes, which is why The Customs Service reiterates its willingness to provide the necessary support for the elucidation of all the circumstances of the occurrence of any violations in the work of subordinate subdivisions.

We remind you that this morning multiple searches were made also in the homes and customs offices of two customs officers. After the operation, were arrested seven people including five customs officers and two businessmen.

We mention that  last month were detained another 28 customs officers from the crossing points of Tudora and Palanca in a similar operation.

items.title: The Customs Service took actions in CNA and PA raids case from Leuseni and Sculeni

fields.lead: The National Agency for Energy Regulation announced the price ceilings for fuels for the next two weeks. Starting with November 2, the price ceiling per liter of gasoline will be lower, while per liter of diesel fuel will be higher.
fields.Continut:
The price ceiling for a liter of gasoline coded 95 was set at 16.78 lei, by 0.6 lei less than two weeks ago. Diesel fuel will cost at most 14.76 lei a liter, as against 14.75 lei during the last two weeks.

The new price ceilings will be applied until November 15.

items.title: ANRE announced new price ceilings // Gasoline cheapens and diesel fuel gets more expensive

fields.lead: The head of the CNA criminal prosecution department, Bogdan Zumbreanu, declared during a press briefing today that the operation held at Sculeni and Leuşeni customs targeted illegal actions of carriers of passengers.
fields.Continut:
The 67 searches (44 in buildings, 8 in cars and 15 in buses) were made today in a dossier started in January this year, while behind them were raised several papers and books on which businessmen were working. 

Prosecutors also have telephone intercepts in which the customs officers negotiated through drivers the bribe amount which businessmen had to give in order to ensure the "smooth functioning" of international routes. Prosecutors documented amounts ranging from 20 euros to 650 euros.

Bogdan Zumbreanu said that some of the detainees have pleaded guilty and cooperate with the investigation.

Customs and border police employees of the border police are accused of taking bribes for international routes in exchange of not charging drivers that circulated in basis of inter-bus cards. Meanwhile, licenses from Auto Transport National Agency costs 9000 euros per route and if a businessman has several routes - 5000 euros. Normally, these drivers were to be charged with 1,200 lei each, and the businessman - with 9,000 lei. 

Following today's operation were arrested 14 customs officers, 3 border police officers, 5 businessmen and 7 drivers. The operation was conducted with the support of the internal security department of Customs Service and Border Police.

items.title: How much is the "protection" of route drivers passing by Sculeni and Leuşeni customs

fields.lead: The Superior Council of Magistracy (SCM) on November 1 suspended the regulations concerning access to courts of law, which contains restrictive norms, especially about the conditions of participation by the mass media in public hearings. Earlier, a number of media organizations and editorial staffs in a joint statement described these regulations as abuse by the SCM, IPN reports.
fields.Continut:
The press service of the SCM stated for Media Azi that the decision to suspend the regulations was taken in the November 1 meeting.

"The members of the SCM reached the conclusion that the regulations contained erroneous provisions that should be revised. They also suggested that all those interested – journalists, representatives of civil society and others – should submit proposals on the issue. The SCM members didn’t set deadlines in this regard," said the press service.

At the end of October, NGOs and editorial staffs of media outlets protested against the imposition by these regulations of abusive restrictions contrary to the European practices in the area of access to information and media access to courts of law. These described the adoption by the SCM of the regulations concerning access to courts of law as abuse by the Council by which additional restrictions on the access to hearings are imposed on journalists and editorial staffs of media outlets. They requested the SCM to annul its decision to approve the regulations and to initiate discussions on the issue with the participation of journalists and media outlets.

The regulations provide, among others, that an application for participation should be filed 24 hours before the hearing, by presenting the identity card and a copy of it and by having special accreditation for access to court of law.

items.title: Superior Council of Magistracy suspends regulations concerning access to courts of law

fields.social_Titlu: Lawyer Ana Ursachi denies accusation of involvement in case of homicide
fields.lead: Lawyer Ana Ursachi denies the accusation that she is involved in a case of homicide that happened 17 years ago and says she is harassed for political reasons.
fields.Continut:
She developed the issue in a special edition of the program “Interpol” on TV 7 channel, IPN reports.

The lawyer said the resumption of the prosecution against her by the Prosecutor General’s Office is unfounded.

"It was proven that I had to relation to this case. No new circumstances appeared to reopen the case," stated the lawyer.

Ana Ursachi considers the reopening of the case against her is political harassment.

"This case represents political revenge. I defended a number of persons who are inconvenient to Vlad Plahotniuc and stated my personal opinion. I became inconvenient thus. I have evidence that Plahotniuc is the one who decides when the cases started by his order should be continued or dropped," she stated.

Ana Ursachi presented a statement that she said was signed by Veaceslav Platon at the end of 2014 and was authenticated by a notary. In this, Platon admits that he made false depositions for Dutch lawyers in order to help Plahotniuc get rid of the distrain imposed on his property worth €46m by a Dutch court.

Ana Ursachi is the lawyer of Veaceslav Platon, Grigore Petrenco and leaders of the Party "Platform Dignity and Truth". The Prosecutor General’s Office reopened a case started against Ana Ursachi in 1998 over the murder of a teacher for appropriating her apartment. Ursachi was acquitted, while her ex-husband Ruslan Moiseev and his accomplice got jail terms.

items.title: Lawyer Ana Ursachi denies accusation of involvement in case of homicide

fields.social_Titlu: “April 7th” case // Two policemen will pay 50,000 MDL for mistreatment of a person
fields.lead: The police officers, Alexandru Mocanu and Gheorghe Vutcariov are obliged to pay into state benefit about 50 000 MDL, for acts of torture and violation of the right to liberty and security, committed in April 2009 on the citizen Vitalie Crețu.
fields.Continut:
The Ministry of Justice intervened with a complaint a year ago, to the General Prosecutor's Office to verify if the actions of the two policemen represent constituent elements of the crime, as a result of detention, ill-treatment and Vitalie Crețu's arrest on 9-10 April 2009 and compensation for the damage caused to the State, according to the Supreme Court of Justice.

For illegal deprivation of liberty over 5 days, and holding in some inhuman and degrading conditions in preventive detention cell, the complainant received from the Moldovan state budget, 25 thousand MDL each, for violation of article 3 and article 5 (paragraph 1) of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (CEDO).

This practice will allow to prevent any convictions of Moldova to the European Court in Strasbourg.

The decision was taken by the Ciocana District Court of the capital, admitting the action to collect in order to regress of the previously paid amount of money to the applicant by the Government.

The civil case, instituted at the request of summons to General Prosecution Office, was examined in a public court hearing by the magistrate, Igor Manascurta, on October 10, 2016. The decision can be appealed at the Court of Appeal within 30 days.

items.title: “April 7th” case // Two policemen will pay 50,000 MDL for mistreatment of a person

fields.lead: The President of "Our Party" Renato Usatîi announced that Interpol Headquarters in Lyon (France) removed him from the international search requested by Moldovan authorities. The announcement was made during a video post on Facebook.
fields.Continut:
"I want to inform the criminal and thievish regime of Plahotniuc that Interpol today removed me from international search. The Central Office did not believe the story of Plahotniuc about ordering the murder of Gorbuntsov ... I found lawyers in the US, EU and Russia that had to demonstrate that I am pursued for political reasons. It did not come to this, because Lyon took me out of the search," he said.

We recall that a similar situation occurred in the spring of 2015. Then, after nearly two months while police searched unsuccessfully for the former Minister of Internal Affairs Gheorghe Papuc, who was sentenced to four years in prison in April 7th case. The representatives of the Ministry of Internal Affairs sent a request to Interpol to be searched abroad. In turn, the international organization refused the request of Moldovan policemen, arguing that it would be about a politically charged case.

items.title: Renato Usatîi announces that he is not searched by Interpol anymore

fields.lead: Viorel Ţentiu, head of Interpol National Central Bureau for Moldova, denies the declaration of Renato Usatii that the Central Office of Lyon would have removed him from the list of searched people. The same statement gave for Deschide.MD the head of Police General Inspectorate (PGI) - Alexandru Pânzari.
fields.Continut:
Both cited sources have told us that they do not have information about the disposal of Usatîi from international search.

"It is not possible that Renato Usatîi would know a decision about which I was not informed," declared Ţentiu.

"We deny the statements of Usatîi. He is wanted, including internationally. We are working with international authorities to arrest and extradite him," added Alexandru Pânzari.

We remind that the president of "Our Party", Renato Usatîi announced that the Central Office of Interpol in Lyon (France) took him out of the international search requested by Moldovan authorities. The announcement was made in a video post on Facebook an hour ago.

"I want to inform the criminal and thievish regime of Plahotniuc that Interpol today removed me from international search. The Central Office did not believe the story of Plahotniuc about ordering the murder of Gorbuntsov ... I found lawyers in the US, EU and Russia that had to demonstrate that I am pursued for political reasons. It did not come to this, because Lyon took me out of the search," he said.

items.title: Moldovan Interpol chief and head of PGI contradict Usatîi: He is internationally wanted!

fields.social_Titlu: Recommendations regarding the Transnistrian region at UN evaluation session
fields.lead: The so-called judicial system of the Transnistrian region does not ensure the observance of human rights and the Moldovan constitutional authorities should institute monitoring mechanisms, with the involvement of civil society. It is also important to ensure the human rights defender’ access to the left side of the Nistru. Such recommendations were made in an UN session that centered on the Universal Periodic Review last week.
fields.Continut:
In a news conference at IPN, “Promo-LEX” jurist Nicoleta Hriplivyi said that in the session a number of states laid emphasis on the existence of systemic problems in the Transnistrian region, while Georgia proposed instituting an efficient mechanism, with the participation of civil society, for monitoring the observance of human rights by the separatist administration.

The jurist noted that the Moldovan delegation pleaded for including the subject of observance of human rights in the 5+2 Transnistrian conflict settlement talks that have focused so far on economic and social problems.

“Promo-LEX” head Ion Manole said that if a victim of the illegalities of the so-called investigation bodies of Transnistria does not have relatives that can defend his interests, this has practically no chance of obtaining justice. In the Transnistrian region, there is no civil society and independent press. In this connection, the Moldovan constitutional authorities and the international organizations are requested to ensure the human rights defender’s access to the region.

“The fact that the Transnistrian administration bans the access of defenders of human rights to the region is a signal that something is being hidden. The persecution and abuses on the part of the investigation bodies continue there,” stated Ion Manole.

The jurists of “Promo-LEX” haven’t had access to the Transnistrian region for over a year and a half. Ion Manole said a society without defenders of human rights is unstable and cannot develop.

“Promo-LEX” manages about 70 cases concerning human rights violations in Transnistria. In about 20 cases of these, the ECHR is to pass judgment. In four cases, the High Court already convicted Moldova and Russia of human rights violations.

Source: IPN
