items.title: Recommendations regarding the Transnistrian region at UN evaluation session

fields.lead: Police took action after an "SMS" appeared a few days ago on Facebook, where the host of the TV show "The Fourth Power" on N4, Gheorghe Gonta, asked the leader of "Our Party" (PN), Renato Usatii, 18 thousand euro. In exchange for this amount, the journalist would have promised the mayor of Balti appearances "as it should be" on his show. The information was confirmed for Deschide.MD by deputy head of Police General Inspectorate (IGP), Gheorghe Cavcaliuc.
fields.Continut:
"Police took action after this message was published by a PN follower and fierce supporter of Usatii. We are investigating the case. The person who posted the message will be cited, Usatii and Mr. Gonta, in order to verify the authenticity of that SMS. After that, according to the gathered information, we will decide on the commencement of criminal investigation or we will order its ending," he declared.

Gheorghe Gonta denied the veracity of this message. However, in a post on Facebook, the PN leader says he was warned by his friends from Internal that in this case is initiated a criminal procedure and that Gheorghe Cavcaliuc keeps it under personal control, naming this as bullshit.

"The officers with patriotic spirit. I do not want to believe this is true. A total aberration !!! «This SMS was published yesterday on the Facebook site of a follower of RU [Renato Usatii - Eds.] and hence police and prosecutor's office took action and has started criminal proceedings on RU on active corruption of the journalist Gheorghe Gonta and regarding Gheorghe Gonta on passive corruption because he received money from the RU as to favor him. Cavcaliuc personally keeps this under control and the Special Operations Department (DOS) examines the case. With this case are dealing two DOS officers, two officers of General Department of Criminal Investigation (DGUP) and 1 prosecutor from General Prosecutor's Office»," wrote Usatii.

On his turn, the journalist Gheorghe Gonta, asked by Deschide.MD reporter, said that the SMS is a fake one and that is a revenge connected with his last interviews during the show that he moderates.

Deschide.MD reminds that in late October, at N4 was supposed to appear an issue with Renato Usatii via Skype, but the last minute, it was canceled. The politician has charged that the decision had been taken by the owners of the TV station under pressure from Plahotniuc, while one of the co-owners told us that the reason was a technical one.

items.title: PREMIERE // Cavcaliuc confirms Usatii's words: "We took notice on the case of the SMS from Gonta"

fields.lead: The mayor of Orhei, Ilan Shor, says that he transferred money to the account of PAS because someone from Maia Sandu's team asked for help. The statement was made today, on the corridors of Buiucani District Court.
fields.Continut:
"I always I helped those in the PLDM, some people of Maia Sandu asked to help, and we helped them. The money's clean, I do not understand why all are worried," he said.

The PAS representatives say they will come up with a response to the statement of Shor in a press conference.

We remind you that last night the blogger, Eugen Luchianiuc, has published some invoices that are showing that an employee of Ilan Shor has made a stately donation to the Party led by Maia Sandu. The nominee for the presidency confirms that the dubious transaction was made yesterday, but she said that she has already initiated the procedure to return the money because they would be dirty. 

Details: Shor's man donated for PAS 300,000 MDL // Sandu: Instigation! We return the money. Dirty money!

items.title: Ilan Shor: I donated money to PAS at the request of some people of Maia Sandu

fields.lead: The persons with locomotor disabilities will be able to go to the polling place free by a social taxi in the runoff presidential elections as well. The service was instituted on the initiative of a group of NGOs.
fields.Continut:
The social taxi was initiated by the Alliance "Infonet" in partnership with the Association "Motivatie", the Association of the Deaf of Moldova and the Medical-Social Rehabilitation Center for Persons with Poor Sight "Low Vision". In a press release, the NGOs say the dispatcher’s office during the first round of voting received 12 calls, but only eight requests could be satisfied, IPN reports.

Therefore, the Association "Motivatie" on November 13 will provide one more specially equipped car for the purpose. The persons with locomotor disabilities will also be taken home by the social taxi from the polling place after voting.

To benefit from this service, the persons with disabilities must call the dispatcher’s office of the service between 9am and 5pm on 022-661-393 or 067300450, at least one hour before the planned trip.

The free service is available only within Chisinau.

items.title: „Social taxi” free for persons with locomotor disabilities on the elections day

fields.social_Titlu: The DNA chief, Laura Codruta Kovesi and the Minister of Justice of Romania comes today to Chisinau
fields.lead: The Ministry of Justice of Romania together with the Ministry of Justice of the Republic of Moldova organizes between 10 to 11 November 2016 in Chisinau, the Forum Romania - Republic of Moldova in Justice - "Reform of justice and fight against corruption in European perspective".
fields.Continut:
At its first edition, the Forum aims to constitute the main platform for communication in the field of justice leading to the development of bilateral cooperation in this area, removing any gaps, and supporting the European course of the Republic of Moldova and Justice in this country by continuing the reforms in the Judiciary system, the fight against corruption. The event will be opened by the Minister of Justice of Romania, Raluca-Alexandra Pruna, Minister of Justice of the Republic of Moldova, Vladimir Cebotari, Speaker of the Moldovan Parliament, Adrian Candu, Romanian ambassador to Moldova, Daniel Ionita, Timp românesc reports.

On this occasion, in Chisinau is also expected the Chief Prosecutor of the National Anticorruption Directorate (DNA), Laura Codruta Kovesi. Her presence has been confirmed for Radio Chisinau by the press service of DNA.

In August, the Ministers of Justice of Romania and Moldova signed in Chisinau a Cooperation Agreement between the two Ministries of Justice. The document outlines the Action Plan between the two public authorities in the period 2016-2018. Through it is targeted the support of Moldova's European path and identification of new opportunities for developing cooperation relations between the two countries in the field of justice.

On the occasion of signing the Agreement, the Minister Raluca Pruna said that "the relationship with Moldova is privileged and strategic. We are obligated to work together effectively and gradually. Romania has no lessons to give, but it has a lot of experience to share."

It is the second agreement of cooperation between the Ministries of Justice of Romania and Moldova, the first being signed in May 2010.

items.title: The DNA chief, Laura Codruta Kovesi and the Minister of Justice of Romania comes today to Chisinau

fields.lead: SA “Apa-Canal Chisinau” said the bids to rehabilitate the Wastewater Treatment Station and the new mud treatment line submitted within an international tender contest will be opened on November 10.
fields.Continut:
In a press release, the public utility says the tender contest, which is held within the Priority Investment Program financed by the EBRD and EIB, is one of the most important contests. As a result of this, the works to modernize the Wastewater Treatment Station will be launched. The company and the inhabitants of Chisinau municipality have long waited for these works to start, IPN reports.

The selected contractor will perform rehabilitation works related to the detailed planning, delivery and installation of new mechanical and electrical equipment at the Chisinau Wastewater Treatment Station and installations for the new mud treatment line, testing and putting into operation of all the delivered equipment, etc.

items.title: From Thursday may be submitted bids to rehabilitate the Wastewater Treatment Station

fields.lead: Representatives of the main justice sector institutions and civil society of Moldova and Romania came together in Chisinau to exchange good practices in justice and the fight against corruption. Speaker of Parliament Adrian Candu voiced hope that the discussion platform will become a tradition and a format for debating ideas and proposals that Moldova can borrow from Romania’s experience in reforming the justice sector, IPN reports.
fields.Continut:
Adrian Candu said that since 2009, the judicial system reform has been a priority for Moldova. Owing to particular delays, the credibility of the law enforcement agencies diminished. "And this is reasonable as we, the politicians, didn’t manage to show sufficient political will so as to go till the end. The situation in the Republic of Moldova, the political and economic crisis we experienced shows that we no longer have excuses and time. What we tried and managed to do this year was to mobilize and lay the foundations of an independent, efficient and correct justice," he stated.

Minister of Justice of Moldova Vladimir Cebotari said the state institutions during the past year showed unprecedented political determination in the reformation process. "The delays in working out reform strategies were the main indicator and the main argument that led to a deterioration in the diplomatic relations between the Republic of Moldova and the development partners. Today, the progress we made in reforming the justice sector, alongside the financial market reforms, is the first sign showing that the Republic of Moldova returns to discussions with the development partners," he stated.

Minister of Justice of Romania Raluca Alexandra Pruna said the forum organized at such a high level shows an impressive solidarity exercise to which the two sides responded. "For Romania, the relationship with the Republic of Moldova is a durable theme on the public agenda. A consensus was reached, as you know, at the level of the Romanian political class, but the consensus existing at the level of Romanian society is even more important. The bilateral cooperation in justice has strategic values and represents an essential component for implementing the strategic partnership between the Republic of Moldova and Romania," said the official.

Raluca Alexandra Pruna added that Romanian went through the reformation and modernization of the state institutions in the European integration process and will share its experience because the modernization of state institutions is impossible without really independent justice.

Romania’s Ambassador in Chisinau Daniel Ionita said the intergovernmental cooperation themes entered the DNA of the Romanian-Moldovan relations. This year Moldova showed the first positive signals in the field through the adoption of the package of laws on the reformation of the prosecution service. The first cases of corruption fighting in state institutions were reported. The country agreement of the IMF with Moldova, approved on November 7, shows that the initiated reforms were appreciated not only in Bucharest, but also at international level.

items.title: Heads of the Romanian justice came to Chisinau to share their experience with Moldovan counterparts

fields.social_Titlu: Another Russian journalist is sent home from the airport. He can return to Chisinau in ... 2030
fields.lead: Moldovan Border Police confirmed the ban of entry into the country for the Russian journalist, Igor Korotcenko, editor-in-chief of "National defense" magazine.
fields.Continut:
Korotcenko earlier stated for RIA Novosti that the Moldovan authorities have banned the entrance in Moldova until 2030 and deprived him of the opportunity to participate in meetings with local experts and political scientists.

"The Border Police confirms that in the afternoon of November 8, in Chisinau International Airport, the citizen of the Russian Federation received a refusal to enter the territory of Moldova after the national court had issued a ban on its behalf" is the answer those of Border Police for RIA.

The Border Policemen have notified Korotcenko the basis in which the prohibition decision was taken. "The sanctions. the ban or the deportation may be introduced by other institutions also, on the basis of various reasons. The information on the existence of prohibitions for entry or transit the country, imposed on a person or another, may be obtained based on an application filed by the person concerned. This information includes personal information", was the reply of those from the Border Police.

Previously, Chisinau imposed similar penalties for a large group of journalists, including against the reporter RIA Novosti, Timur Hursandov, but also against the representatives of NTV, REN TV, Life News televisions and other media.

items.title: Another Russian journalist is sent home from the airport. He can return to Chisinau in ... 2030

fields.lead: Acting Prosecutor General, Eduard Harunjen, promises that Vlad Filat's file and his conviction will be made public after the decision of the Appeal Court is issued. The statement was made during the first Moldovan-Romanian Forum of justice, following a question from the audience in the hall. However, in the hall are the heads of all institutions of the Romanian judicial system and their Moldovan counterparts.
fields.Continut:
Harunjen said from the start that the question exceeds him because the management strategy of this case was decided by a certain prosecutor which has independence of action. He also recognized that in terms of institutional PR, the General Prosecutor's Office would gain much more if this process would have been public.

"I would like to think that the society wants a result from justice and is less interested in the show. I do not know if it is our luck or misfortune, but in a very short period we have been able to investigate two former prime ministers being prosecuted for various infringements. Many of the actions that we undertook have generated some unprecedented attacks on our institution," said Harunjen.

Acting Prosecutor General mentioned that Vlad Filat was controlling several media institutions in the moment of his detention through which he put pressure on the criminal prosecution body.

"I think it is no secret that the investigated subject has a lot of media trusts through which he tried to exert pressure. As it is no secret for jurists that a dossier on such a scale in which huge amounts are being investigated, respectively - is compressed a huge political force, no doubt there is pressure on the participants of the process," he said.

Harunjen assured that the dossier of the former prime-minister will be made public when will be completed the incorporation and legalization of evidence process and where it will not go on what means evidentiary material.

"You do realize well that the conviction cannot be kept secret forever, it will be published, but we have two courts examining the meritsof cause. I would not want to justify myself, but it is unreally hard to manage such cases, to give assurances to the trial participants that they will not be put under pressure from different social groups," said the acting head of state accusers.

Harunjen concluded that the examination of the secret dossier of Filat was done according to the legal provision which says that in special cases, the file can be examined in a closed session.

items.title: Harunjen: I promise you that after the decision of the Appeal Court, Filat's file will be published

fields.social_Titlu: UPDATE //  The building on Uzinelor street that was engulfed in flames risks to collapse
fields.lead: Update (17.30) The over 100 firefighters continue to struggle with the fire that engulfed the warehouse on Uzinelor Street. 4 more fire engines were sent to the spot. After almost eight hours, the fire hasn’t been yet localized.
fields.Continut:
UPDATE (15:39) More people unite and donate for the family of the dead fireman. Internet users have created an account for donations on guvern24.md where everyone can make a transfer to help financially the family of the fireman who died on duty. Prime Minister, Pavel Filip as well asked the State Chancellery to provide financially the firefighter's family.

As well, first deputy president of PD, Vlad Plahotniuc announced on his Facebook page that "together with Edelweiss Foundation he will provide initially an aid of 150,000 lei, and then will pay for a year, every month, 15,000 lei for maintenance of the two twin girls and in order to solve urgent financial problems."

UPDATE (15:14) Liliana Puscasu: At the moment firefighters try to cool the building area for this not to collapse. Inspectors of Patrol stopped road traffic and evacuated people from nearby because there is a real danger that the edifice will collapse.

UPDATE (15:09) At the beginning of the Central Electoral Commission meeting, the committee members held a minute of silence in memory of the firefighter who died on duty today trying to save several people who were in the building.

UPDATE (14:30) Prime Minister Pavel Filip requested the Prosecutor's Office of Chisinau to investigate the circumstances of the warehouse fire on Uzinelor street and death of the firefighter Nogailic. During the urgent meeting, Filip requested the Chancellery to prepare the necessary documents to give the one who lost his life on duty today the highest distinction of the Republic of Moldova and proper aid for his family.

The head of Civil Protection and Emergencies Service, Mihail Harabagiu, the firefighter who died was among the first who arrived at the scene. He broke a window to enter the building to evacuate people. At one point, the firefighter fell into the void from a height of three meters and a half. He was found at a distance of several dozen meters from the place of fall.

Pavel Filip requested Harabagiu to present as urgent as possible a report on the causes of fire's outbreak and officers who inspected the building in terms of causing fire and an analysis of the response of firefighters.

UPDATE (13:58) Seven firefighters who took part in the extinguishing of the fire on Uzinelor St were taken to the Hospital “Saint Trinity” in Chisinau. Two of them received medical care and could leave, while the others were hospitalized with poisoning. 

According to the hospital’s press officer Tatiana Gumene, a woman involved in the fire was also brought to them. Her state is grave, but stable, IPN reports.

UPDATE (13:42) The name of the fireman who died on duty was Ivan Nogailic and he was 28 years old. He had worked at the Civil Protection and Emergencies Service from 2009. His last post was that of team chief at the Rescuers and Firefighters Post of the Service’s National Intervention Center. He had the rank of major sergeant. He was married and had two children. The whole personnel of the Service expressed condolences to the family and close relatives. His colleagues fought for the life of the blocked fireman for more than an hour.

UPDATE (13:30) Firefighters still try to extinguish the flames from the warehouse which is located in a building on Uzinelor street from the capital. In these moments are hospitalized three firefighters.

They got intoxicated with carbon monoxide, but did not suffer burns.

UPDATE (13:03) Prime Minister Pavel Filip convenes today, November 11, 2016, at 14:00, an emergency meeting at the Government with those responsible on the fire in the Ciocana district of Chisinau.

UPDATE (12:57) "The firefighter who was taken out by the DSE climbers, died. He is an DSE employee from the the Republican Center of Operational Services who died on duty. He was 28 years old. He served for a long time on the duty," said DSE press officer.

Liliana Puscasu, told the press that the firefighter who was evacuated from the building that this morning was engulfed in flames, died. He has been for more than 40 minutes on the fourth floor of the building. The same source added that another firefighter who tried to save his colleague was also transported to the hospital.

"The firefighter who died is 28 years old. He served for a long period in the rescue and fire service. He is a real hero who unfortunately died on duty. Everything possible has been done to save this person, inclusively the physicians have made every effort in the ambulance, and also the fellow rescuers and firefighters who changed the tubes with oxygen, but unfortunately they failed to save him," said Puscasu, adding that it is not known yet how many people are still in the building.

UPDATE (12:37) The fireman who was blocked in the building on Uzinelor street, where this morning, a devastating fire broke out, was evacuated from the building. He is in unconscious and was transported to the hospital. The information was confirmed by DSE press officer, Liliana Puscasu.

UPDATE (12:29) In these moments a team of climbers are trying to get out the blocked fireman. The situation is tense. Within minutes we will be back with details of how this operation was conducted.

UPDATE (12:07) Firefighters still endeavor to get their colleague out from the building where the fire broke out. He is blocked for more than half an hour on the fourth floor of the building and his oxygen tube was changed. Similarly, according to the latest information two civilians needed medical care and also a firefighter. The information was confirmed by DSE press officer, Liliana Puscasu.

UPDATE (11:42) A firefighter got trapped in the building on Uzinelor Street, his colleagues are trying to save him. DSE press officer, Liliana Puscasu added that prior two women, a man and a firefighter needed medical care after they got intoxicated with carbon monoxide.

Requested by IPN, Spokesperson of the National Center for Prehospital Emergency Medical Assistance, Diana Blanaru, said that patients picked up at the spot were given first aid and later they were taken to the municipal hospital "Holy Trinity". Their health is of medium gravity.

Publika.MD video filmed with the drone from the fire scene on Uzinelor street:

UPDATE (11:07) Firefighters managed to get one person out of the building. DSE press officer, Liliana Puscasu declared for Publika.MD that according to the latest news, a few minutes ago was rescued a man. Meanwhile, is not known his condition, he, most likely, got intoxicated with carbon monoxide.

LIVE Realitatealive.md from the location of the fire.

 

A deadly fire started this morning in Chisinau, located on 9 Uzinelor street. At this time, 14 fire fighting vehicles are on the spot and 2 auto-stairs because the flames broke out on the fourth floor of the building.

The information was confirmed for Deschide.MD by DSE press officer, Lilliana Puscasu, who added that according to the latest information more people were evacuated from the building previously and that no one was hurt. 

The firefighters have received the call about the fire around 9:58 a.m. Once arrived the firefighters found out that the flames broke out at a warehouse with easily flammable materials. The same source also informed us that the fire can be qualified as one of level III, due to the extent of flames and firefighters use every supplied means to extinguish flames.

PHOTO: Publika.MD

The news updates...

items.title: UPDATE // The building on Uzinelor street that was engulfed in flames risks to collapse

fields.social_Titlu: Lucky number 13! Selfie contest with prizes in Cluj to mobilize Moldovan voters
fields.lead: In the context of the runoff for presidential elections in Moldova, the International Forum of Romanian Journalists (FIJR) organizes a contest designed to encourage voting.
fields.Continut:
Thus, the voters who will be present on Sunday at the polling station at the Culture House for Students from the Cluj-Napoca can earn 5 city breaks to European capitals and 13 Samsung smartphones.

#Selfie13 is the competition which with a simple photo you can win prizes. It is necessary to make a selfie before the House of Culture of Students from the Cluj, this Sunday, and then send it on the Facebook page of the event: www.facebook.com/alegeeuropa. Do not forget to attach your name and contact details (telephone) to the message.

The contest will run only on election day - the day when you can CHOOSE THE EUROPE! The sound of the slogan of the event sounds like that. The organizers of FIJR will centralize all selfie messages sent, following to be held live on Facebook on 14 November, draw, which will appoint the winners.

"The gesture of the journalists is directed primarily towards Bessarabians from Ardeal, who will pass on Sunday at the Culture House of Students in Cluj and are eager to CHOOSE EUROPE '' it is said in a statement of FIJR.

items.title: Lucky number 13! Selfie contest with prizes in Cluj to mobilize Moldovan voters

fields.lead: The Court of Appeal upheld today the decision of the Buiucani District Court on Vlad Filat. The former prime minister remains sentenced to 9 years in prison. However, the same court reduced the amount of money to be confiscated from Filat's fortune from 792 million MDL to 479 million MDL, admitting this way the demarche of many callers, including the ex-Prime Minister's wife, Sanda Diviricean.
fields.Continut:
After the delivery of the decision the politician told the press that the decision of the Court of Appeal is illegal.

"It is an illegal decision. We go further," he said.

Vlad Filat was arrested after a self-denunciation of Ilan Shor, saying that while Filat was prime minister, he offered them money, goods and services worth 250 million dollars in return for government favors. By the decision of Buiucani District Court on 27 June, Filat was sentenced to nine years in prison and a fine of 60 thousand MDL. Vlad Filat pleads not guilty.

Moreover, the premier will not pay for the benefit of the National Anticorruption Centre the amount of 15 561 MDL.

The news is updating...

items.title: The Court of Appeal maintains the decision of the first instance // 9 years for Filat

fields.lead: After 99.9% of the votes were counted, the Central Election Commission said Igor Dodon gathered over 835,000 votes, while Maia Sandu over 761,000. More than 1.6 million people cast their ballots, which is over 53% of the voters on electoral rolls.
fields.Continut:
According to the CEC, the highest turnout of voters was recorded in the municipality of Chisinau – over 58%. The lowest turnout was in Cantemir district – about 41% of the voters.

The profile of voters shows that the 26-40 age category was the most active one. The turnout in this category was over 27%. The number of women who voted in elections was by almost 100,000 higher than that of men.

CEC president Alina Russu said two more electoral reports were processed by this hour – from a polling place in Sacramento, U.S., and from a polling place in Montroy, France. Only two of the reports came to the CEC in paper form – from the districts of Soldanesti and Dubasari.

CEC member Iurie Ciocan said the two parcels with lost ballots reached the destination. They were sent back to Chisinau without being opened.

items.title: Igor Dodon garnered 835,010 votes, while Maia Sandu 761,934

fields.social_Titlu: 44-year-old woman also died in the warehouse fire in Chisinau
fields.lead: A woman aged 44 who had an 11-year-old daughter and a son aged 20 died in last week’s storehouse fire in Chisinau. The woman was from Revaca commune of Sangera town.
fields.Continut:
When the fire started, the woman was inside the storehouse and she could not escape. Her carbonized remains were found the building four days later, IPN reports.

The platform guvern24.md made a public appeal to donate money so as to raise €1,000 for the woman’s burial.

In the case of the killed fireman, the platform made a similar appeal for collecting about 300,000 lei, which is the family’s debt to a bank. The necessary sum was raised and measures are now being taken to clear the debt.

items.title: 44-year-old woman also died in the warehouse fire in Chisinau

fields.lead: Over 680 thousand cyber attacks were recorded on government websites in the day that was held the presidential runoff. The primary information about attempted attacks on the web pages of several state institutions in Moldova has been confirmed for Deschide.MD by the press officer of Security and Intelligence Service (SIS), Daniela Manzatu, then was detailed by the chief executive of the Center of Special Telecommunications (CTS), Serghei Popovici.
fields.Continut:
A staff of about 25 administrators were "enrolled" on election day to deal with cyber attacks.

The chief executive of the Center of Special Telecommunications told us that 62 thousand attacks were of "thor" and "proxy" type. At 18:00 began a series of very powerful attacks on the page of Ministry of Foreign Affairs, however, CTS managers have successfully managed their rejection.

In addition, the Central Election Commission (CEC) website was also attacked, but not so strong as mfa.gov.md.

When asked how he explains the technical problems of CEC website after processing of ballots began, Serghei Popovici told us that if they appeared to some Internet users that happened only because of overcrowding this site. "In those moments on CEC website were around 7,000 concurrent users."

We recall that in the first round of presidential elections the website of the Central Election Commission of Moldova suffered over 41,000 cyber attacks. According to specialists, they were intensified after 21:00, when the counting and processing of votes started.

items.title: EXCLUSIVE // About 680 thousand cyber attacks on Election Day. Where were the most powerful?

fields.lead: The public association “Honor, Dignity and Homeland” (ODIP) brought the people to the streets to protest against the fraud on election day. Organizers say it is not a manifestation of the Union message, but simply a protest directed against irregularities that were committed in the presidential runoff. They gathered in front of the high school "Gheorghe Asachi", from where they marched to the embassies in Chisinau to ask them not to recognize the election results.
fields.Continut:
Demonstrators want the third round of elections, then CEC's resignation.

The crowd is chanting:

- We want the third round!

- Russia don't forget, Moldova is not yours!

- Russian Army go out!

- Defrauded vote! 

- And you, and you come with us!

- Publika go out! (Vlad Biletchi, ODIP president,  says he had nothing against this tv channel, if it had not manipulate that the protest had been organized by the "DA" Platform, which was joined then by ODIP). 

The broadcast of the event takes place only on Facebook:

items.title: (VIDEO) ODIP again in the streets // The second day of protests after the victory of Igor Dodon

fields.social_Titlu: News ALERT // Cavcaliuc: „Vitas” was detained this morning at Vadul lui Voda
fields.lead: (UPDATE 07:55 a.m.) Vitalie Burlacu's detention, aka "Vitas" has been confirmed for Deschide.MD by the deputy head of the Police General Inspectorate (IGP), Gheorghe Cavcaliuc. According to him, "Vitas" was detained this morning by IGP officers in Vadul lui Voda, while the convict was in a car. "More details will be provided to the media via a communique or a press briefing," concluded Gheorghe Cavcaliuc.
fields.Continut:
The IGP investigation officers detained Vitalie Burlacu, "aka" - The Karate man - the main figurehead in the dossier on corruption of MP's. The information was confirmed for Deschide.MD portal by reliable sources within the institution. Burlacu is one of the close men of the businessman Veacelsav Plato, as confirmed by businessman himself - nicknamed "The No.1 Raider" in the CIS.

The main accused in the corruption case of MPs, Vitalie Burlacu, was wanted in April, currently being issued an arrest warrant of 30 days on his name. A few months later, the court sentenced him to 11 years and 4 months of imprisonment, the sentence being delivered in his absence.

His friend, who figures in the same case - Irina Baglai - was sentenced to three years of imprisonment with suspension for a period of two years.

Vitalie Burlacu still has to pay a fine of 160 thousand MDL. However, the prosecutors demanded the confiscation of the money found during prosecution. It is about approximately 550 thousand euros and about 400,000 dollars.

In the MPs corruption file, initiated in 2014, are targeted the former police officer Vitalie Burlacu and the model Irina Baglai. Firstly, the two have been arrested after they were investigated at large. They are suspected of trying to offer to an MP 250 thousand dollars to convince him to leave the fraction to which he belongs.

items.title: News ALERT // (UPDATE) „The corruption of MPs” case // „Vitas” was detained this morning at Vadul lui Voda

fields.lead: Central Election Commission (CEC) announced that it was notified on three attempts of multiple voting in the presidential election on November 13.
fields.Continut:
According to CEC president, Alina Russu, such cases occurred in Briceni, Anenii Noi and Nisporeni.

"We apprised the Police General Inspectorate as the competent authority to investigate these actions", she said.

Russu also said that CEC was notified in connection with organized transportation of citizens residing in Transnistria to the polling stations. In this regard IGP has also been informed to investigate the cause.

Head of IGP general public security department, Marin Maxian, confirmed to Deschide.MD the information received from the Central Election Commission. According to him, now the police identifies the situation in order to confirm or decline those announced.

items.title: Three attempts of multiple voting on election day investigated by police
